props.title: Das Konjunktiv II Futur I (German Subjunctive II past tense): usage, conjugation and exercises

sections.content: The Konjunktiv II Futur I, also refered as just Konjunktiv II with werden, is a verb form in German that expresses hypothetical, unreal, or imagined actions or events that may occur in the future. Its use is prefered to the Konjunktiv II Präteritum with most verbs.
The Konjunktiv II Futur I  is frequently used and you must learn it!
We use the Konjunktiv II Präteritum tense for:

items.text: Expressing Hypothetical Future Actions: Used to describe what could, might, or would happen in the future under certain conditions:

example.audio: Er würde morgen kommen, wenn er Zeit hätte.
example.text: Example: Er $__würde-werden[verb-link-hover]__$ morgen $__kommen-kommen[verb-link-hover]__$, wenn er Zeit hätte.
example.translation: (He would come tomorrow if he had time)

items.text: Polite or Formal Requests About the Future. Used to sound more polite or less direct when discussing future actions

example.audio: Ich würde morgen mit Ihnen sprechen
Es würde regnen, wenn die Wolken dichter werden.
example.text: Example: Es $__würde-werden[verb-link-hover]__$ $__regnen-regnen[verb-link-hover]__$, wenn die Wolken dichter werden.
example.translation: (It would rain if the clouds became denser)

sections.content: The Konjunktiv II Futur I is formed with the Konjunktiv II  form of werden + the infinitive of the main verb.

image.alt: How to form the Konjunktiv II Futur I in German

sections.content: Therefore, it is important to know the Konjunktiv II  form of werden:

table.audio: ich spielte, du spieltest, (er) (sie) (es) spielte, wir spielten, ihr spieltet, sie spielten.

sections.content: Make sure you practise it until you master it! After that you will just need to study the word order.
Word order in sentences using Konjunktiv II Futur I follows the rules for compound tenses.
